page.title: 18VILLAGE MEMORIES
page.content: {Mrs Tyreman}started work as the Post Lady in 1943 when letters cost 1.5d to send. Her round of ten miles covered the village and the outlying farms as far as Gormire. She cycled and walked carrying the letters (over a hundred each day) in a large sack on her shoulder. She wore a navy uniform with a red stripe and had a hat. As well as delivering letters Mrs Tyreman would take orders for bread and would post mail for people. She always carried 30d worth of stamps with her as she was not allowed to collect an unstamped letter. In 1985 nine postman on a weekly rota system cover the 40 mile route in a small van. They still carry stamps (to the value of Â£1) and collect letters from outlying farms.
